children.text: Core Confusion: The user is grappling with the distinction between a DNS record and a hostname, particularly when the same string (e.g., bbc.co.uk) is used for both. They correctly perceive a subtle difference in context—one as a public network pointer, the other as a local machine identifier—and are seeking the fundamental, unifying concept that explains their relationship. This struggle is intensified by the evolution of DNS in cloud-native and Kubernetes environments where these concepts become more abstracted.
